feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 3:54PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...VALDEZ GLACIER DAMMED LAKE RELEASING... Valdez Glacier Dammed Lake on the Valdez Glacier is releasing causing rises on the Valdez Glacier Lake and Stream. The Valdez Glacier Stream is currently at 20.3 ft and has risen over 3 ft since Monday morning. The event is mirroring the release a year ago and is expected to rise an additional 2-3 ft to around 22.5 ft

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued June 08 at 8:07AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR PINAL COUNTY THROUGH THURSDAY... The Pinal County Department of Air Quality has extended an Ozone High Pollution Advisory for Pinal County including Apache Junction, Casa Grande, Coolidge, and Florence through Thursday. This means that forecast weather conditions combined with existing ozone levels are expected to result in local maximum 8-hour ozone

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 1:42PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heating Up This Week, Then Increasing Winds This Weekend... * Summer`s first multi-day period of heat is projected Thursday through Saturday. Highs well into the 90s in Western Nevada and into the 80s for Sierra communities are expected, with potential for some records on Friday. There is a chance of cities such as Reno (15%) and Fallon (50%) of hitting 100 degrees on Friday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 1:42PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heating Up This Week, Then Increasing Winds This Weekend... * Summer`s first multi-day period of heat is projected Thursday through Saturday. Highs well into the 90s in Western Nevada and into the 80s for Sierra communities are expected, with potential for some records on Friday. There is a chance of cities such as Reno (15%) and Fallon (50%) of hitting 100 degrees on Friday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 4:38AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 100 AND 107 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED ACROSS MUCH OF SOUTHEAST TEXAS TODAY AND THURSDAY WITH HIGHER VALUES ANTICIPATED AT THE END OF THE WEEK AND ON THROUGH THE WEEKEND... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 3:05AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 105 AND 109 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED TODAY... The combination of warm temperatures and high dewpoints will produce heat indices between 105 and 109 degrees today. Residents with outdoor activities planned are urged to drink plenty of water, wear light weight and light colored clothing and take frequent breaks from the heat. Young children and pets should never be left

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 07 at 1:50PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Recent rains and mountain snowmelt have resulted in rises along the Yakima River. This has resulted in minor flooding in some areas along the river. * WHERE...A small portion of Kittitas County northwest of Cle Elum. Specifically the Elk Meadows subdivision along the Yakima River.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 07 at 1:29PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RAIN AND SNOW MELT WILL RESULT IN RISES ON RIVERS AND SMALL STREAMS IN THE CASCADES LATE THIS WEEK INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK... An atmospheric river arrives on Thursday into the weekend bringing periods of moderate rainfall and warm, windy conditions. Rain amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible along the Cascade crest. In addition, rivers fed by melting snow, from the Cascades and
